DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study assess effect repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation ( rTMS ) civilian patient confirm diagnosis post-traumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) . This research study determine whether low-frequency ( 1 Hertz [ Hz ] ) high-frequency ( 10 Hz ) rTMS right dorsolateral prefrontal cortex ( DLPFC ) effect symptom PTSD compare sham rTMS treatment .
DOC.criteria: primary diagnosis PTSD determine structure interview use Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview ( MINI ) change psychotropic medication within 4 week start rTMS age > 19 year < 70 year competency give informed consent nonfixed metal object implant ( include cochlear implant ) brain , skull , scalp , neck within 30 cm magnetic rTMS coil implantable device , include cardiac pacemaker defibrillator contraindication rTMS , include history seizure ( except childhood febrile seizure ) recent unexplained syncope , firstdegree relative history epilepsy , treatment medication know substantially decrease seizure threshold , pregnancy psychiatric diagnosis psychosis psychotic disorder ( include psychotic depression ) , bipolar type I disorder , organic mental disorder substance abuse/dependence within past 3 month active suicidal risk judge clinician borderline antisocial personality disorder acute medical illness , include cancer significant central nervous system disorder , brain mass , stroke , etc .
